lead_paragraph: Millions of people are still driving vehicles with Takata airbags that may pose a lethal danger because they have not been repaired or, in some cases, even recalled.

byline.contributor: Hiroko Tabuchi reported from Rock Hill and Danielle Ivory from New York.
byline.original: By HIROKO TABUCHI and DANIELLE IVORY

headline.print_headline: Faulty Airbags Still Exact Toll as Recalls Lag
headline.main: Takata’s Faulty Airbags Still Exact Toll as Recalls Lag

snippet: Millions of people are still driving vehicles with Takata airbags that may pose a lethal danger because they have not been repaired or, in some cases, even recalled.
abstract: Vast number of faulty Takata-manufactured airbags have not been repaired or recalled over decade since first confirmed rupture, posing threat to tens of millions of drivers and passengers; drivers report long waits for vehicle repairs and refusal of automakers to provide loaner cars in interim; National Highway Traffic Safety Admin does not have authority to order people to stop driving cars and has not issued any advisory to do so.
